ayas.translation: In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful.
By the Star when it goes down,-
Your Companion is neither astray nor being misled.
ayas.transliteration: mā ḍalla ṣāḥibukum wa mā ghawā

ayas.translation: Nor does he say (aught) of (his own) Desire.
It is no less than inspiration sent down to him:
He was taught by one Mighty in Power,
Endued with Wisdom: for he appeared (in stately form);
While he was in the highest part of the horizon:
Then he approached and came closer,
And was at a distance of but two bow-lengths or (even) nearer;
So did (Allah) convey the inspiration to His Servant- (conveyed) what He (meant) to convey.
The (Prophet's) (mind and) heart in no way falsified that which he saw.
Will ye then dispute with him concerning what he saw?
For indeed he saw him at a second descent,
Near the Lote-tree beyond which none may pass:
Near it is the Garden of Abode.
Behold, the Lote-tree was shrouded (in mystery unspeakable!)
(His) sight never swerved, nor did it go wrong!
ayas.transliteration: mā zāghal baṣaru wa mā ṭaghā

ayas.arabic: لَقَدْ رَأَىٰ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰٓ
ayas.translation: For truly did he see, of the Signs of his Lord, the Greatest!
ayas.transliteration: laqad ra-ā min āyāti rabbihil kubrā

ayas.translation: Have ye seen Lat. and 'Uzza,
And another, the third (goddess), Manat?
What! for you the male sex, and for Him, the female?
Behold, such would be indeed a division most unfair!

ayas.arabic: إِنْ هِىَ إِلَّآ أَسْمَآءٌ سَمَّيْتُمُوهَآ أَنتُمْ وَءَابَآؤُكُم مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلْطَـٰنٍ ۚ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهْوَى ٱلْأَنفُسُ ۖ وَلَقَدْ جَآءَهُم مِّن رَّبِّهِمُ ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ
ayas.translation: These are nothing but names which ye have devised,- ye and your fathers,- for which Allah has sent down no authority (whatever). They follow nothing but conjecture and what their own souls desire!- Even though there has already come to them Guidance from their Lord!
ayas.transliteration: in hiya illā asmā-un sammaytumūhā antum wa-ābā-ukum mā anzalallāhu bihā min sulṭān ۚ in yattabi`ūna illaẓ ẓanna wa mā tahwal-anfus ۖ walaqad jā-ahum min rabbihimul hudā

ayas.translation: Nay, shall man have (just) anything he hankers after?
But it is to Allah that the End and the Beginning (of all things) belong.

ayas.arabic: وَكَم مِّن مَّلَكٍ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ لَا تُغْنِى شَفَـٰعَتُهُمْ شَيْـًٔا إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعْدِ أَن يَأْذَنَ ٱللَّهُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَرْضَىٰٓ
ayas.translation: How many-so-ever be the angels in the heavens, their intercession will avail nothing except after Allah has given leave for whom He pleases and that he is acceptable to Him.
ayas.transliteration: wakam min malakin fis samāwāti lā tughnī shafā`atuhum shay-an illā min ba`di an ya-dhanallāhu liman yashā-u wayarḍā

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ تَسْمِيَةَ ٱلْأُنثَىٰ
ayas.translation: Those who believe not in the Hereafter, name the angels with female names.
ayas.transliteration: innal ladhīna lā yu-minūna bil-ākhirati layusammūnal malā-ikata tasmiyatal-unthā

ayas.arabic: وَمَا لَهُم بِهِۦ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ ۖ وَإِنَّ ٱلظَّنَّ لَا يُغْنِى مِنَ ٱلْحَقِّ شَيْـًٔا
ayas.translation: But they have no knowledge therein. They follow nothing but conjecture; and conjecture avails nothing against Truth.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā lahum bihi min `il-m ۖ in yattabi`ūna illaẓ ẓann ۖ wa innaẓ ẓanna lā yughnī minal ḥaqqi shay-ā

ayas.arabic: فَأَعْرِضْ عَن مَّن تَوَلَّىٰ عَن ذِكْرِنَا وَلَمْ يُرِدْ إِلَّا ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا
ayas.translation: Therefore shun those who turn away from Our Message and desire nothing but the life of this world.
ayas.transliteration: fa-a`riḍ `an man tawallā `an dhikrinā walam yurid illal-ḥayātad dunyā

ayas.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مَبْلَغُهُم مِّنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ
ayas.translation: That is as far as knowledge will reach them. Verily thy Lord knoweth best those who stray from His Path, and He knoweth best those who receive guidance.
ayas.transliteration: dhālika mablaghuhum minal `il-m ۚ inna rabbaka huwa a`lamu biman ḍalla `an sabīlihi wahuwa a`lamu bimanih-tadā

ayas.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ لِيَجْزِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسَـٰٓـُٔوا۟ بِمَا عَمِلُوا۟ وَيَجْزِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا۟ بِٱلْحُسْنَى
ayas.translation: Yea, to Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: so that He rewards those who do evil, according to their deeds, and He rewards those who do good, with what is best.
ayas.transliteration: walillāhi mā fis samāwāti wa mā fil-arḍi liyajziyal ladhīna asā-ū bimā `amilū wayajziyal ladhīna aḥsanū bil ḥusnā

ayas.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجْتَنِبُونَ كَبَـٰٓئِرَ ٱلْإِثْمِ وَٱلْفَوَٰحِشَ إِلَّا ٱللَّمَمَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَٰسِعُ ٱلْمَغْفِرَةِ ۚ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِكُمْ إِذْ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِذْ أَنتُمْ أَجِنَّةٌ فِى بُطُونِ أُمَّهَـٰتِكُمْ ۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوٓا۟ أَنفُسَكُمْ ۖ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱتَّقَىٰٓ
ayas.translation: Those who avoid great sins and shameful deeds, only (falling into) small faults,- verily thy Lord is ample in forgiveness. He knows you well when He brings you out of the earth, And when ye are hidden in your mothers' wombs. Therefore justify not yourselves: He knows best who it is that guards against evil.
ayas.transliteration: alladhīna yajtanibūna kabā-iral-ithmi wal fawāḥisha illallamam ۚ inna rabbaka wāsi`ul maghfirah ۚ huwa a`lamu bikum idh ansha-akum minal-arḍi wa idh antum ajinnatun fī buṭūni ummahātikum ۖ falā tuzakkū anfusakum ۖ huwa a`lamu bimanit-taqā

ayas.translation: Seest thou one who turns back,
Gives a little, then hardens (his heart)?
What! Has he knowledge of the Unseen so that he can see?

ayas.arabic: أَمْ لَمْ يُنَبَّأْ بِمَا فِى صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ
ayas.translation: Nay, is he not acquainted with what is in the Books of Moses-
ayas.transliteration: am lam yunabba-bimā fī ṣuḥufi mūsā

ayas.translation: And of Abraham who fulfilled his engagements?-
Namely, that no bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another;

ayas.arabic: وَأَن لَّيْسَ لِلْإِنسَـٰنِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ
ayas.translation: That man can have nothing but what he strives for;
ayas.transliteration: wa-an laysa lilinsāni illā mā sa`ā

ayas.translation: That (the fruit of) his striving will soon come in sight:
Then will he be rewarded with a reward complete;
That to thy Lord is the final Goal;
That it is He Who granteth Laughter and Tears;
That it is He Who granteth Death and Life;
That He did create in pairs,- male and female,
From a seed when lodged (in its place);
That He hath promised a Second Creation (Raising of the Dead);
That it is He Who giveth wealth and satisfaction;
That He is the Lord of Sirius (the Mighty Star);
And that it is He Who destroyed the (powerful) ancient 'Ad (people),
And the Thamud nor gave them a lease of perpetual life.

ayas.arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِّن قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ هُمْ أَظْلَمَ وَأَطْغَىٰ
ayas.translation: And before them, the people of Noah, for that they were (all) most unjust and most insolent transgressors,
ayas.transliteration: waqawma nūḥin min qabl ۖ innahum kānū hum aẓlama wa-aṭghā

ayas.translation: And He destroyed the Overthrown Cities (of Sodom and Gomorrah).
So that (ruins unknown) have covered them up.
Then which of the gifts of thy Lord, (O man,) wilt thou dispute about?
This is a Warner, of the (series of) Warners of old!
The (Judgment) ever approaching draws nigh:

ayas.arabic: لَيْسَ لَهَا مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ
ayas.translation: No (soul) but Allah can lay it bare.
Do ye then wonder at this recital?
And will ye laugh and not weep,-
Wasting your time in vanities?
But fall ye down in prostration to Allah, and adore (Him)!
